title: When LeBron James said 'Ain't no party like Diddy party' in resurfaced video
content: ​​Diddy has not pleaded guilty to three felony counts and has been refused bail. His arrest would open a can of worms as several celebrities were linked to him and apparently took part in his Freak Off parties. But no one has yet been implicated and just taking part in his Freak Offs won't mean they were also involved in trafficking.
summary: ​​Diddy has not pleaded guilty to three felony counts and has been refused bail. His arrest would open a can of worms as several celebrities were linked to him and apparently took part in his Freak Off parties. But no one has yet been implicated and just taking part in his Freak Offs won't mean they were also involved in trafficking.

title: 'Chill the f**k out': Woman 'steals' man's Apple charger on JetBlue flight, says she was going to give it back
content: ​As the video posted by the man went viral now showing the woman as an unscrupulous thief, Vanessa, the woman, shared her side of the story. She said the incident took place almost over a year ago but now that the man's video went viral on TikTok, she was bombarded with harassment and hence felt the need to come up with a clarification.
summary: ​As the video posted by the man went viral now showing the woman as an unscrupulous thief, Vanessa, the woman, shared her side of the story. She said the incident took place almost over a year ago but now that the man's video went viral on TikTok, she was bombarded with harassment and hence felt the need to come up with a clarification.

title: 'There are consequences if ... ': Russia widens nuclear weapons doctrine, issues warning to West
content: The Kremlin has updated its nuclear doctrine, allowing for the use of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states under certain conditions. This change is aimed at countries supporting Ukraine in its conflict with Russia. The revised policy expands the list of military threats that could justify a nuclear response and includes more states and alliances.
summary: The Kremlin has updated its nuclear doctrine, allowing for the use of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states under certain conditions. This change is aimed at countries supporting Ukraine in its conflict with Russia. The revised policy expands the list of military threats that could justify a nuclear response and includes more states and alliances.

title: Israel rejects ceasefire plans, says goal to 'crush' Hezbollah in Lebanon
content: Israeli finance minister Bezalel Smotrich has turned down a 21-day ceasefire proposal, stating that the offensive should conclude with Hezbollah's defeat. The US and its allies had suggested the ceasefire to prevent further escalation. Israeli airstrikes have hit multiple Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, as concerns about a full-scale war grow.
summary: Israeli finance minister Bezalel Smotrich has turned down a 21-day ceasefire proposal, stating that the offensive should conclude with Hezbollah's defeat. The US and its allies had suggested the ceasefire to prevent further escalation. Israeli airstrikes have hit multiple Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, as concerns about a full-scale war grow.

title: Kate Middleton reaches out to 'homesick' Prince Harry after spotting 'worrying signs': Report
content: On September 15, Prince Harry turned 40 and received birthday wishes from Kate Middleton and Prince William. Kate crafted the message to help restore peace between Harry and his family amid ongoing tensions. The gesture was appreciated by Harry, who celebrated with his family in California before attending a gathering with friends.
summary: On September 15, Prince Harry turned 40 and received birthday wishes from Kate Middleton and Prince William. Kate crafted the message to help restore peace between Harry and his family amid ongoing tensions. The gesture was appreciated by Harry, who celebrated with his family in California before attending a gathering with friends.

title: Taliban calls gender discrimination claims 'absurd' as four nations push for legal action
content: The Taliban have denied allegations of gender discrimination and human rights abuses amid plans by Australia, Canada, Germany, and the Netherlands to take legal action against them. These countries seek to hold Afghanistan accountable under international law for its treatment of women and girls. The initiative has garnered support from over 20 nations.
summary: The Taliban have denied allegations of gender discrimination and human rights abuses amid plans by Australia, Canada, Germany, and the Netherlands to take legal action against them. These countries seek to hold Afghanistan accountable under international law for its treatment of women and girls. The initiative has garnered support from over 20 nations.

title: Alabama schedules second Nitrogen gas execution amid controversy
content: Alabama is preparing for its second nitrogen gas execution amid debates on the method's humaneness. The first use in January led to a painful death for Kenneth Smith, raising constitutional concerns. Alam Eugene Miller, convicted of triple murder, is scheduled next. Critics urge further evaluation before proceeding with more executions.
summary: Alabama is preparing for its second nitrogen gas execution amid debates on the method's humaneness. The first use in January led to a painful death for Kenneth Smith, raising constitutional concerns. Alam Eugene Miller, convicted of triple murder, is scheduled next. Critics urge further evaluation before proceeding with more executions.

title: 'I also ... ': What Elon's mother said on Musk-Meloni dating rumours
content: Maye Musk addressed the rumours of her son, Elon Musk, dating Georgia Meloni after a viral photo led to public speculation. She clarified that she was seated next to Elon and admired Meloni. Elon Musk also denied the claims. The rumours were fueled by his praise for Meloni at an awards ceremony in New York.
summary: Maye Musk addressed the rumours of her son, Elon Musk, dating Georgia Meloni after a viral photo led to public speculation. She clarified that she was seated next to Elon and admired Meloni. Elon Musk also denied the claims. The rumours were fueled by his praise for Meloni at an awards ceremony in New York.

title: Jhumpa Lahiri turns down award over New York museum's kaffiyeh ban
content: Jhumpa Lahiri, an India-origin author, has declined the 2024 Isamu Noguchi Award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens. This move is in protest against the museum's updated dress code policy, which resulted in firing three employees for wearing kaffiyehs to show solidarity with Palestinians. The policy bans clothing or accessories displaying political messages.
summary: Jhumpa Lahiri, an India-origin author, has declined the 2024 Isamu Noguchi Award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens. This move is in protest against the museum's updated dress code policy, which resulted in firing three employees for wearing kaffiyehs to show solidarity with Palestinians. The policy bans clothing or accessories displaying political messages.

title: Biden wants to make active shooter drills in schools less traumatic for students
content: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order to help schools develop less traumatic but effective active shooter drills. The order also seeks to limit technologies that make guns easier to fire and obtain. A task force will investigate machine-gun-conversion devices and 3D-printed guns, reflecting Biden's ongoing commitment to curbing gun violence.
summary: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order to help schools develop less traumatic but effective active shooter drills. The order also seeks to limit technologies that make guns easier to fire and obtain. A task force will investigate machine-gun-conversion devices and 3D-printed guns, reflecting Biden's ongoing commitment to curbing gun violence.

title: UK shortlists four developers including Rolls Royce for small nuclear projects
content: Britain has advanced Rolls Royce, GE-Hitachi Nuclear Energy, Westinghouse, and Holtec Britain in its competition to develop small modular nuclear reactors. The government plans to select two companies for deployment in the 2030s. This initiative aims to replace older plants with more cost-effective and faster-to-build SMRs to meet net zero targets.
summary: Britain has advanced Rolls Royce, GE-Hitachi Nuclear Energy, Westinghouse, and Holtec Britain in its competition to develop small modular nuclear reactors. The government plans to select two companies for deployment in the 2030s. This initiative aims to replace older plants with more cost-effective and faster-to-build SMRs to meet net zero targets.

title: World's longest-serving death row prisoner proven innocent in Japan
content: Iwao Hakamada, once a professional boxer, was acquitted after spending nearly half a century on death row for a crime he did not commit. DNA evidence revealed his innocence, leading to his release in 2014. His case has exposed significant flaws in Japan's legal system and sparked debates over its reliance on confessions and use of the death penalty.
summary: Iwao Hakamada, once a professional boxer, was acquitted after spending nearly half a century on death row for a crime he did not commit. DNA evidence revealed his innocence, leading to his release in 2014. His case has exposed significant flaws in Japan's legal system and sparked debates over its reliance on confessions and use of the death penalty.

title: Shocking revelations about Vince McMahon made by popular WWE Superstars
content: Recent revelations by WWE stars shed light on Vince McMahon's controversial management style. Incidents include asking Shane McMahon to stab him during a backstage dispute, overworking wrestlers without breaks, and regularly booking talent to lose in their hometowns. These disclosures offer a troubling glimpse into the practices behind WWE's success.
summary: Recent revelations by WWE stars shed light on Vince McMahon's controversial management style. Incidents include asking Shane McMahon to stab him during a backstage dispute, overworking wrestlers without breaks, and regularly booking talent to lose in their hometowns. These disclosures offer a troubling glimpse into the practices behind WWE's success.

title: 'I don't think ...': What JD Vance said about his upcoming debate against opponent Tim Walz
content: JD Vance, the Republican Vice Presidential nominee, claims minimal preparation is needed for his upcoming debate against Tim Walz as he focuses on Trump's policies and criticizes Kamala Harris. Conversely, Walz is preparing extensively at a multiday camp in Michigan. The debate is set for October 1 and will be hosted by CBS.
summary: JD Vance, the Republican Vice Presidential nominee, claims minimal preparation is needed for his upcoming debate against Tim Walz as he focuses on Trump's policies and criticizes Kamala Harris. Conversely, Walz is preparing extensively at a multiday camp in Michigan. The debate is set for October 1 and will be hosted by CBS.

title: Taliban could face Hague tribunal for their treatment of women and girls
content: Australia, Canada, Germany, and The Netherlands are set to initiate legal proceedings against the Taliban government over violations of women's rights in Afghanistan. The case may go to the International Court of Justice. Since August 2021, Afghan women have faced severe restrictions under Taliban rule. This unprecedented move has garnered international support and condemnation of the Taliban's actions.
summary: Australia, Canada, Germany, and The Netherlands are set to initiate legal proceedings against the Taliban government over violations of women's rights in Afghanistan. The case may go to the International Court of Justice. Since August 2021, Afghan women have faced severe restrictions under Taliban rule. This unprecedented move has garnered international support and condemnation of the Taliban's actions.

title: Ukraine President making nasty aspersions toward your favorite president, me: Trump
content: Donald Trump criticized President Biden's approach to the Russia-Ukraine war, suggesting Ukraine should have made concessions before the invasion. He argued any deal would be better than the current situation. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy expressed doubts about Trump's ability to end the conflict and plans to present a victory plan to the White House.
summary: Donald Trump criticized President Biden's approach to the Russia-Ukraine war, suggesting Ukraine should have made concessions before the invasion. He argued any deal would be better than the current situation. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy expressed doubts about Trump's ability to end the conflict and plans to present a victory plan to the White House.

title: 21-year-old rock climber dies in tragic fall from Devils Tower in US
content: A 21-year-old climber named Stewart Phillip Porter from Wisconsin fell to his death while rappelling down Devils Tower National Monument in Wyoming. He was on the second pitch of El Cracko when he fell. Authorities pronounced him dead at the scene and later rescued his stranded partner. The National Park Service urged climbers to adhere to safety precautions during descents.
summary: A 21-year-old climber named Stewart Phillip Porter from Wisconsin fell to his death while rappelling down Devils Tower National Monument in Wyoming. He was on the second pitch of El Cracko when he fell. Authorities pronounced him dead at the scene and later rescued his stranded partner. The National Park Service urged climbers to adhere to safety precautions during descents.

title: New Zealand navy passes through Taiwan strait for first time in years
content: The New Zealand Navy sailed a military vessel through the Taiwan Strait for the first time in seven years, alongside an Australian destroyer. This routine passage adheres to international law. Additionally, New Zealand condemned China's missile launch and cyberattacks, while considering joining the AUKUS security pact with Australia, the UK, and the US.
summary: The New Zealand Navy sailed a military vessel through the Taiwan Strait for the first time in seven years, alongside an Australian destroyer. This routine passage adheres to international law. Additionally, New Zealand condemned China's missile launch and cyberattacks, while considering joining the AUKUS security pact with Australia, the UK, and the US.

title: 'Zelenskyy ought to say thank you to American taxpayers': JD Vance on Russia-Ukraine war
content: JD Vance, Republican vice presidential nominee, asserted that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy should be grateful to American taxpayers for their financial support. He criticized Zelenskyy's demands and stated that a Trump-Vance administration would end the Ukraine war through strong leadership. The US has provided extensive aid to Ukraine, while denying requests for long-range missiles.
summary: JD Vance, Republican vice presidential nominee, asserted that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy should be grateful to American taxpayers for their financial support. He criticized Zelenskyy's demands and stated that a Trump-Vance administration would end the Ukraine war through strong leadership. The US has provided extensive aid to Ukraine, while denying requests for long-range missiles.

title: 'Miracles': How Melania reacted to husband Trump's assassination attempts
content: In her first TV appearance in over two years, Melania Trump recounted learning about two assassination attempts on Donald Trump's life. She praised the Secret Service's response and called for more answers regarding these incidents. This comes ahead of her memoir release and a task force hearing on security failures.
summary: In her first TV appearance in over two years, Melania Trump recounted learning about two assassination attempts on Donald Trump's life. She praised the Secret Service's response and called for more answers regarding these incidents. This comes ahead of her memoir release and a task force hearing on security failures.
